error.signature: SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0
error.regex: Unexpected token .? in JSON at position|JSON\.parse.*SyntaxError|is not valid JSON

verdict.summary: JSON.parse received non-JSON data. Common: API returned HTML error page instead of JSON.

dead_ends.action: Add try/catch and return empty object
dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the real issue â€” the response isn't JSON

dead_ends.action: Strip non-JSON characters from the string
dead_ends.why_fails: If you're getting HTML, stripping won't make it JSON

workarounds.action: Log the actual response text to see what was returned (often an HTML error page)
workarounds.how:
const text = await res.text();
console.log(text); // see what the server actually sent

workarounds.action: Check response status before parsing: if (!res.ok) throw new Error(res.statusText)
Verify the API URL is correct and the server is returning JSON content-type

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'SyntaxError' indicates a JavaScript syntax error, while 'Error' indicates a refused TCP connection.
'SyntaxError' indicates a JavaScript syntax error, while 'npm error Missing script' indicates a missing npm script in package.json.
